channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: 9 foreign students fined over unlawful gathering in flat
item.description:
June 05, 2020 5:00 AM

Nine students from India were fined on Wednesday for unlawfully gathering in an apartment on May 5, while circuit breaker measures were still in effect.

item.title: Coronavirus: Dorm operators expect changes to push up costs by at least 50%
item.description:
June 05, 2020 5:00 AM

New standards for migrant worker dormitories will enhance workers' well-being, said dormitory operators here, but will come at a cost increase of at least 50 per cent to implement in existing dorms.

item.title: Jail and fine for trying to smuggle animals
item.description:
June 05, 2020 5:00 AM

A man who tried to smuggle 22 animals - including endangered and poisonous frogs - into Singapore in his rented car was caught at Woodlands Checkpoint on Nov 10 last year.

item.title: Coronavirus: Staff can work at more than one site if job scope requires it
item.description:
June 05, 2020 5:00 AM

Even though cross-deployment of employees to different worksites is not allowed due to workplace measures taken to stop the spread of Covid-19, employees can work at more than one site if their job scope requires them to do so.

item.title: Road Safety Month launched as Singapore reopens
item.description:
June 05, 2020 5:00 AM

The eighth Singapore Road Safety Month was launched on Tuesday, with traffic expected to increase as Singapore entered the first phase of its post-circuit breaker reopening.

item.title: Coronavirus: Visitor arrivals to Singapore hit historic low in April
item.description:
June 05, 2020 5:00 AM

The number of visitors to Singapore plummeted to a historic low of 748 in April, the first full month since a ban on short-term visitors was put in place.

item.title: Woman allegedly swindled six out of $1m
item.description:
June 05, 2020 5:00 AM

A 47-year-old woman who is an undischarged bankrupt was charged yesterday with swindling six people out of over $1 million meant to be used for foreign exchange investments.

item.title: Over $7m lost to scammers posing as tech support staff
item.description:
June 05, 2020 5:00 AM

More than $7 million has been lost to scammers posing as technical support staff in the first four months of this year, an increase of more than 40 times from the same period last year.

item.title: Budget payouts to Singaporeans set to hit $3.5b in June
item.description:
June 05, 2020 5:00 AM

The total amount given out to Singaporeans to help them cope with the Covid-19 pandemic, under the Care and Support Package and the Solidarity Payment this year, is set to reach $3.5 billion this month.

item.title: Singapore embarks on 'epic challenge' to help job seekers
item.description:
June 05, 2020 5:00 AM

As an economic storm gathers on its doorstep, Singapore is preparing to meet it and do all it can to create pathways and opportunities for job seekers, Manpower Minister Josephine Teo said yesterday.

item.title: HDB resale volume hits new low, but prices hold steady
item.description:
June 05, 2020 5:00 AM

Housing Board flat resale volume plunged to a new low last month, compounding the already dismal transaction levels seen in April.

item.title: Law Society intervenes in two practices
item.description:
June 05, 2020 5:00 AM

The Law Society has intervened in the practice of two law firms and frozen their client accounts.

item.title: Singaporeans to get up to $1k in payouts this month
item.description:
June 05, 2020 5:00 AM

Eligible Singaporeans will receive up to $1,000 this month to help them with living costs, under schemes previously announced by the Government.

item.title: 3 firms fined $32,000 for colluding to rig bids for WRS projects
item.description:
June 05, 2020 5:00 AM

Three construction companies were found to have colluded to rig the bids for eight tenders and quotations called by Wildlife Reserves Singapore (WRS), said the Competition and Consumer Commission of Singapore (CCCS) yesterday.

item.title: Doc struck off for wrongly certifying cause of death
item.description:
June 05, 2020 5:00 AM

A doctor has been struck off the Register of Medical Practitioners for wrongly certifying the cause of death. This is the fourth time he has been found guilty of doing this.

item.title: Tide turning for soya bean seller who adopted cashless system
item.description:
June 05, 2020 5:00 AM

When Mr Goy Thuan Heng introduced cashless payments at his soya bean stall in West Coast Hawker Centre five years ago, it was more trouble than it was worth at first.

item.title: More calls to govt helpline for seniors, carers during circuit breaker
item.description:
June 05, 2020 5:00 AM

Social distancing measures have been hard on some people, especially the vulnerable and seniors such as Madam Lai Yuet Meng.

item.title: Work injury at home: Employer still responsible for compensation
item.description:
June 05, 2020 5:00 AM

The fact that employees might be working from home does not change an employer's responsibility for work injury compensation (WIC), said Minister of State for Manpower Zaqy Mohamad yesterday.

item.title: Over 10,000 workers matched to new jobs by NTUC council
item.description:
June 05, 2020 5:00 AM

More than 10,000 workers who were displaced or at risk of losing their jobs have been matched with new roles by the National Trades Union Congress (NTUC) Job Security Council in the past few months, said labour chief Ng Chee Meng.

item.title: Upcoming app aims to tackle food wastage and food insecurity
item.description:
June 05, 2020 5:00 AM

An application for matching food donors with organisations that provide food to the needy is expected to be rolled out in the last quarter of the year.

item.title: Reasons for hope in face of gathering storm: Josephine Teo
item.description:
June 05, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore should not underestimate how rough the weather might become as it gears up for a storm, said Manpower Minister Josephine Teo yesterday.

item.title: Power supply reinstated at more than 4,000 unused sites for Covid-19 purposes
item.description:
June 05, 2020 5:00 AM

More than 4,000 sites have been reconnected to the national power grid since the coronavirus outbreak alert level was raised to orange in Singapore on Feb 7, according to national grid power operator SP Group.

item.title: Bear in mind stresses of working from home, say MPs
item.description:
June 05, 2020 5:00 AM

With the continued need for social distancing in Singapore, many employees have had to adapt to working from home, which comes with its own set of challenges, said several MPs yesterday.

item.title: Teen admits to attacking boyfriend's dad with knife
item.description:
June 05, 2020 5:00 AM

A teenager attacked her then boyfriend's father with a knife last year, causing him to suffer cuts to his fingers.

item.title: 13 new cases in community from one shophouse
item.description:
June 05, 2020 5:00 AM

A shophouse in Veerasamy Road in Little India was the residence of 13 of the 15 Covid-19 community cases announced yesterday. It is also linked to an earlier confirmed case.

item.title: 4 new coronavirus clusters in dorms and worksite in Singapore
item.description:
June 05, 2020 12:01 AM

The Ministry of Health (MOH) also said that there were no Singaporeans among the 15 new cases announced earlier on Thursday.
